pages.text: <hl1>Redstone</> must be one of the most important aspect of #minecraft. At the moment, #mubble does not add that much redstone items, but we still have a few of them, with some interesting concepts!

pages.title: Fancy Extensions
pages.text: As seen in $(l:blocks/building_materials#terraconcrete_stuff)the chapter about <b>building blocks</>, #mubble adds new buttons and new pressure plates.<++>If you consider them like redstone components, there is also a couple of doors and pressure plates, that you will be able to find in other parts of the book.

The <b>placer</> joins the family of dispensers and droppers. Ever felt like something was missing there? Yes, some extra properties for <hl1>blocks</>. With the placer, you can... well... <hl1>place blocks</>!<++>Put a <hl1>tool</> in it and it will try to <hl1>break</> the block in front of it.

pages.title: Recipe
pages.text: Be also aware that placing and breaking blocks with the placer will match your logic: <hl2>waterlogging</> will work the same for example, and you can't break stone without storing a pickaxe inside.

The <b>fluid tank</> can store water and lava. It has 6 glass faces that can be opened and closed at will. You can use this to store liquids in an easier way, or even create some intelligent new contraptions.
